alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Garden; Grant; Keith (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 10:47PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Arthur, southeastern Grant, northwestern Keith, southwestern Hooker, southeastern Garden and northwestern McPherson Counties through 1130 PM CDT/1030 PM MDT/... At 1047 PM CDT/947 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles southwest of Mullen to 7 miles north of Oshkosh. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oshkosh, Arthur, Lewellen, Flatts, Cogill Lake, Green Lake, Bucktail Lake, Bourquim Hill, Three Mile Lake, Sugar Loaf Hill, Ruthon, Haythorn Lake, Lena, Sand Puddin Lake, Big Lamunyon Flats, McKeag, East Cody Lake, Calora and Ash Hollow State Historical Park. This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 110 and 142. Highway 92 between mile markers 115 and 123, and between mile markers 165 and 190. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT/1000 PM MDT/ for the Panhandle of and west central Nebraska.
